data.title: Very good food
data.text: Took other TA recommendations and got the wings, they were amazing. Didn't care for the Alabama white BBQ sauce that came with them but they put a whole six-pack of different sauces on the table which made it fun. Also had fried green tomatoes that were very good, breading was nice and crusty but a little slimy on the inside. Husband had pork plate said it was great.  Great service. Only negative was filthy bathroom with only one working stall.  Really makes me wonder how clean things are behind the scenes.

data.title: Amazing Wings!
data.text: Must try the smoked wings with the Alabama White Sauce! Best wings I've ever had! You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Excellent ribs and sides
data.text: The ribs were smoked just right plus very well tasting cornbread muffins, grits and collard greens.  I should have had the wings without the sauce as the flavors were offsetting each other, but enjoyed none-the-less.  Have to get the full rack of ribs as excellent and you pay less than half the price again as the half rack.

data.title: Very nice place
data.text: Everything on the menu is great. The wings are amazing you must try the famous and almost famous wings.

data.title: Awesome bbq.
data.text: Had lunch here today.  Was well pleased.  Very friendly staff and owner.  I had the ribs with a double order of collars.   They were both very good.  The ribs were smoked and then grill with a slight char for a wonderful taste.  The collards were awesome.  They apparently are going for a more younger to middle aged crowd with high top tables but the seating is very comfortable.  Nice fully stocked bar.  And they also have patio dinning.  Moderately priced but well worth it.  I think they have live music maybe at dinner.  I'll be going back on my next trip to Augusta.

data.title: Best Barbecue Ever!!!!
data.text: I visited this location with friends. We had the best time and the food was A1. This was the best barbecue that I have ever had, especially locally.  The portions of food that they serve is more than enough. There was a live band which we really enjoyed also. I have been again since my first visit and will be going again this weekend with more friends. This is by far one of my favorite establishments. Cant wait for Friday to get here!!

data.title: Great BBQ priced right
data.text: This is the place for dry rubbed ribs. It was a nice portion of meat that fell off the bones. Had nachos as an appetizer and they were deliciously decadent. Mac and cheese was a 10 out of 10. Our server Keely was attentive and overall this was a great experience.

data.title: Best new hangout
data.text: The food is casual and you need to be prepared to wait if you get there past 7pm. The live music is normally pretty good. Staff are friendly and helpful. A reliable spot for a good time.

data.title: Glad I tried it :-)
data.text: I had the Firebird sandwich with sweet potato fries with a side of fried pickle spears. The food was cooked properly and tasted good. The pickle spears were not soggy, but crisp and tasty. I would have liked some different beer choices; but overall, a good choice. The service was good. Erin, our server, was attentive and gave good service. The decor was down to earth.

data.title: Mystery Menu
data.text: Party of 8. My first time eating there. I opened the Menu and there were no prices listed. I ordered the Big Boy Pork sandwich because I was hungry. After placing the order and receiving our drinks the waitress said Oh, by the way tonight is 6 wings free when you order 6. That would have been nice to know while we were looking at the menu. The sandwich came and it was mostly a bun. There must have been a pork shortage in Augusta. You only get one side of chips with the entree and if you want say hash and rice, like me, it is $1.00 more. After the sandwich and side, Ice tea, tip, and tax the bill was $16.00. I can eat twice at Mott's BBQ for that much. I don't mind paying that for a good hearty sandwich, but I was disappointed in this one. I'm not sure I'll rush back there anytime soon. Take your chances with this place my friend.

data.title: Everything is excellent!!!
data.text: Went there for the first time today and was very glad I did.  From the moment I walked in the door, everyone that worked there was extremely friendly and pleasant.  I sat at the bar to eat and was served by Meredith, who was absolutely delightful.  I had researched the menu online so I knew what I wanted to order.  Got "The Godfather", which is a sampler platter of ribs, pulled pork, smoked chicken and wings.  It came with 2 sides.  I had hash and rice and baked beans.  To drink I had an Arnold Palmer with unsweet tea.  I have to say that everything was on point, right down to the drink.  The wings are smoked in the on site smoker then flash fried for serving which crisps them up and seals in the juices.  They were large and incredibly tender and juicy.  Nothing comes with sauce on it.  They have 5 different sauces for the meat and a dipping sauce for the wings and while the sauces are good, I enjoyed them without it.  Definitely will be returning.  They also have a brunch menu on the weekend.

data.title: Cool barbeque joint
data.text:
Lets be clear this is a barbeque place.  They have a smoker on site and make everything there except the blue cheese dressing.
Interesting enough I had none of it.  We went for brunch on Sunday and they had a limited menu.  I had the biscuit the pimento cheese and friend chicken with a side of grits.  All very tasty. Nice cover eating area outside.  Helpful staff. Good service.
Parking could be an issue.  I would suggest expanding the brunch menu.

data.title: Two Thumbs Down
data.text: I am not sure where to start...I ordered the barbeque sandwich and rice and hash.  It was a spoonful of meat on a much larger bun.  The hash and rice was about a tablespoonful and was served on a piece of paper on a small baking sheet....hash and rice on a sheet of paper!  Three children in our party and even the 3 yr old girl didn't get enough to eat.  The service was lousy.  A big word of caution..even though they have kids menus they have ugly pictures of women in the mens restroom.   If you want to eat a barbeque sandwich thats mostly bread in a loud obnoxious atmosphere, this is your place.

data.title: Augusta's Local BBQ Joint
data.text:
If you’re looking for the authentic, local hang-out South Bound Smokehouse is your spot. Popular with the locals and the college crowd, this restaurant and bar was busy with activity. With The Masters Tournament highlights playing on the TVs and a local band up on stage, the atmosphere is where the locals come to unwind with a pint and some real, southern BBQ.

The food is good, but probably won’t be winning any culinary awards any time soon. South Bound is where to come to experience what it’s like a be true Augustan.

data.title: Need a second go at it...
data.text: After a magazine article I decided to try this bbq place.  Atmosphere was nice, similar to many bbq restaurants but with a sport bar feel due to tvs everywhere.  Staff was attentive.  Decided to go the ribs, side of collards and Mac & Chz.  Ribs were okay, sides were excellent.  Had fried pickle spears app, great.  I give 3 stars due to the ribs, but plan to return for pull pork at some point and if good, I would give this place 4 stars.

data.title: Addictive.
data.text: Boom! Best spot in town for a beverage and grub for a game. Nice staff. Cool young crowd. Good live music. Must get the wings!

data.title: Local Fun Place!
data.text: I should confess that when I heard my friends were taking me to have bbq I was not excited.  My expectations were far less than what South Bound Delivered.  The atmosphere was great, the service was friendly and efficient even though the place was hopping and to top it off, the food was good!   I had the wings and they were great.  Trivia moved along very slow, but other than that, I can't wait to go back!

data.title: Don't bother!
data.text: We love bbq!  Love to try other's bbq, but this wasn't good at all.  It wasn't bad... It just wasn't anything!  No flavor!  The smoked chicken barely has any smoked flavor to it and the texture was more like sawdust than bbq.  The pork has little flavor.  The hush puppies are very good, as are the pork rinds.  But nothing else. Other sides are unremarkable.

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text:
Decided to give South Bound Smokehouse a try since I live just around the corner. It was wonderful!

Kevin was our server and he was so helpful. He gave suggestions, answered all our questions, and was very attentive.

Because we couldn't decide on what to order, both my mom and I ordered The Godfather. That gave us a good sampling of ribs, wings, pulled pork and pulled chicken along with 2 sides. It was a lot of food so we both took home leftovers.

We plan on returning soon. I loved to learn they have trivia (and food and drink specials) on Wednesdays. I just have to check it out!

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: Been coming here since day one. Since then the place continues to get better and better. Friendly staff, owners, and crowd. Great live music and the wings are the best in Augusta! It's crazy to say that the salads are even the best in Augusta. Must try! It will not disappoint.
